points.description: Designed with high cranking ability for more power and enhanced vibration resistance, keeping the vehicle safe and damage-free.
Crafted for smoother rides on tough roads, with added protection of built-in safety mechanisms.
Made with state-of-the-art technology to offer modern-day features and cater to new-age vehicles.

faqs.title: What should I consider while buying a battery?
faqs.content: There are multiple factors that must be considered while buying a battery. However, battery size, warranty, and power (CCA and RC) are some of the most important aspects to consider.

faqs.title: What does CCA mean?
faqs.content: CCA stands for Cold Cranking Amps, which is a rating used to define the battery’s ability to start the engine of a vehicle in cold temperatures. The CCA rating is determined by the number of amps a fully charged new battery can deliver for 30 seconds at 0° F. In short, the higher the CCA rating, the better the battery starting power.

faqs.title: What does RC mean?
faqs.content: RC stands for Reserve Capacity, which is a battery rating that defines its ability to power up a vehicle with a fan belt or inoperative alternator. RC rating is the number of minutes a battery takes to discharge at 80° F and 25 amps. The higher the RC rating, the longer the vehicle’s operating capacity in case of fan belt or alternator failure.
